jodd.mail

Class CommonEmail<T extends CommonEmail<T>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • jodd.mail.CommonEmail<T>
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Email, ReceivedEmail

    public abstract class CommonEmail<T extends CommonEmail<T>>
extends java.lang.Object
    Common stuff for both Email and ReceivedEmail.

        public T subject(java.lang.String subject)
        Sets message subject.
        Parameters:
        subject - The message subject to set.
        Returns:
        this

      • subject

        public T subject(java.lang.String subject,
                 java.lang.String encoding)
        Sets message subject with specified encoding to override default platform encoding. If the subject contains non US-ASCII characters, it will be encoded using the specified charset. If the subject contains only US-ASCII characters, no encoding is done and it is used as-is. The application must ensure that the subject does not contain any line breaks. See MimeMessage.setSubject(String, String).
        Parameters:
        subject - The message subject
        encoding - The encoding for the message subject.
        Returns:
        this

      • subject

        Returns message subject.

        message subject.

      • priority

        public T priority(int priority)
        Sets email priority.
        Parameters:
        priority - - Values of 1 through 5 are acceptable, with 1 being the highest priority, 3 = normal and 5 = lowest priority.
